item.title: Helen add a quote by Montaigne
item.description: "Behold the hands, how they promise, conjure, appeal, menace, pray, supplicate, refuse, beckon, interrogate, admire, confess, cringe, instruct, command, mock and what not besides, with a variation and multiplication of variation which makes the tongue envious." -- Montaigne

item.title: Helen add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "A woman is like a tea bag; you never know how strong it is until it's in hot water." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Helen add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "So many books, so little time." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Helen add a quote by John Lancaster Spaulding
item.description: "The highest courage is to dare to appear to be what one is." -- John Lancaster Spaulding

item.title: Helen add a quote by Laurel Thatcher Ulrich
item.description: "Well-behaved women seldom make history." -- Laurel Thatcher Ulrich

item.title: Helen add a quote by Maya Angelou
item.description: "Pretty women wonder where my secret lies. I'm not cute or built to suit a fashion model's size But when I start to tell them, They think I'm telling lies. I say, It's in the reach of my arms The span of my hips, The stride of my step, The curl of my lips. I'm a woman Phenomenally. Phenomenal woman, That's me." -- Maya Angelou

item.title: Helen add a quote by Allen Saunders
item.description: "Life is what happens to you while you're busy making other plans." -- Allen Saunders

item.title: Helen add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "No one can make you feel inferior without your consent." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Helen add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "You gain strength, courage and confidence by every experience in which you really stop to look fear in the face. You are able to say to yourself, 'I have lived through this horror. I can take the next thing that comes along.' You must do the thing you think you cannot do." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Helen add a quote by Denis Waitley
item.description: "The greatest gifts you can give your children are the roots of responsibility and the wings of independence." -- Denis Waitley

item.title: Helen add a quote by Martina Mcbride
item.description: "A statue stands in a shaded place An angel girl with an upturned face A name is written on a polished rock A broken heart that the world forgot" -- Martina Mcbride

item.title: Helen add a quote by Anthony Brandt
item.description: "Other things may change us, but we start and end with the family." -- Anthony Brandt

item.title: Helen add a quote by Elizabeth Berg
item.description: "You are always in my thoughts. When you were little, I knew your whereabouts at any given moment. Now that you are...off on your own, I still always know where you are, because I keep you in my heart." -- Elizabeth Berg

item.title: Helen add a quote by Carlos Castaneda
item.description: "The trick is in what one emphasizes. We either make ourselves miserable, or we make ourselves happy. The amount of work is the same." -- Carlos Castaneda
